sect3.title: Updating the sources
sect3.para: If you are running a stable NetBSD release (such as NetBSD 3.1), in a production environment, you should occasionally update your sources and rebuild the system or the kernel, in order to incorporate any security fixes that have been applied to the branch since its release.

Most of the following steps can be done as ordinary user. Only the installation of a new kernel and the userland will require root privileges. Although /usr is choosen as the working directory in the following examples, the procedure can also take place in a user's home directory. Ordinary users have normally not the permissions to make changes in /usr, but this can be changed by root.
You can retrieve or update the sources for your release using anoncvs over ssh by specifying the correct branch tag. For example, to checkout the sources for the NetBSD 3.1 release, you could use:
sect3.programlisting: $ cd /usr $ export CVS_RSH=ssh $ cvs -d anoncvs@anoncvs.NetBSD.org:/cvsroot co -r netbsd-3-1 -P src
sect3.note: Be sure to take care in selecting the correct and desired branch tag so you don't accidently downgrade your source tree.

sect3.title: Building a new userland
sect3.para: Please always refer to build.sh -h and the files UPDATING and BUILDING for details - it's worth it, there are many options that can be set on the command line or in /etc/mk.conf.

sect3.title: Installing the kernel and userland
sect3.para: Installing the new kernel, rebooting (to ensure that the new kernel works) and installing the new userland are the final steps of the updating procedure:
sect3.programlisting: $ cd /usr/src $ su # mv /netbsd /netbsd.old # mv /usr/src/sys/arch/<ARCH>/compile/<KERNEL>/netbsd / # shutdown -r now ... $ cd /usr/src $ su # ./build.sh -O ../obj -T ../tools -U install=/
sect3.para: If the new kernel netbsd does not boot successfully, you can fall back on booting the netbsd.old kernel.

sect3.title: Updating only parts of the source tree
sect3.para: If a security advisory has been issued, and you want to just rebuild the necessary libraries and applications, your best bet is to follow the instructions provided in the advisory. An example is given below:
sect3.programlisting: $ cd src $ export CVS_RSH=ssh cvs update -d -P -r netbsd-3-1 gnu/dist/sendmail/sendmail $ cd gnu/usr.sbin/sendmail $ make USETOOLS=no cleandir dependall $ su # make USETOOLS=no install
